intro: Palhinhaea cerrojefensis, commonly known as the Cerrojeje palm, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, mountainous environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing fruit that is used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
